summary: This document is a series of evidence custody forms from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General, detailing property seized from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in relation to case NYFO 2019-010614. The seized items include staff logs, personnel files, phone logs, and inmate records, primarily from July-August 2019, indicating an investigation into the custody and conditions surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

events.title: Evidence Seizure at MCC
events.description: DOJ OIG special agents seized property including personnel files, post orders, sign-in sheets, and training records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Seizure of Log Books
events.description: DOJ OIG seized a green law enforcement/BOP staff log book and a green social visiting log book from the MCC.

events.title: Seizure of Phone Logs and Rounds
events.description: DOJ OIG seized phone log printouts for multiple extensions and 30-minute rounds documentation from the MCC.

events.title: Period Covered by Seized Logs
events.description: Seized evidence includes Tru-Intel log entries, daily forms, and 30-minute rounds documentation covering this period, which includes the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

locations: BOP MCC (Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General seized extensive records from the MCC in August 2019 under case number NYFO 2019-010614, which is the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Seized items include personnel files for staff (M. Thomas, T. Noel), inmate commissary records (including Epstein's), phone logs, staff log books, and security rounds documentation.
The evidence covers the critical period from July 1, 2019, to August 19, 2019, encompassing Epstein's final weeks of incarceration.
The seizure indicates a thorough investigation into prison operations, staff conduct, and inmate monitoring procedures at the MCC.
Chain of custody logs show the evidence was transferred to inventory/storage, documenting proper handling procedures.
